Package dev.todoapp.infrastructure

Class Network

java.lang.Object
software.amazon.jsii.JsiiObject
software.constructs.Construct
dev.todoapp.infrastructure.Network
All Implemented Interfaces:
software.amazon.jsii.JsiiSerializable, software.constructs.IConstruct, software.constructs.IDependable
public class Network extends software.constructs.Construct
Creates a base network for an application served by ECS. The network stack contains a VPC, two public and two isolated subnets, an ECS cluster, and an internet-facing load balancer with an HTTP and an optional HTTPS listener. The listeners can be used in other stacks to attach to an ECS service, for instance.

The construct exposes some output parameters to be used by other constructs. You can access them by:

  • calling getOutputParameters() to load the output parameters from a Network instance
  • calling the static method getOutputParametersFromParameterStore(Construct, String) to load them from the parameter store (requires that a Network construct has already been provisioned in a previous stack)

  • Method Details

    • getOutputParametersFromParameterStore

      public static Network.NetworkOutputParameters getOutputParametersFromParameterStore(software.constructs.Construct scope, String environmentName)
      Collects the output parameters of an already deployed Network construct from the parameter store. This requires that a Network construct has been deployed previously. If you want to access the parameters from the same stack that the Network construct is in, use the plain getOutputParameters() method.
      Parameters:
      scope - the construct in which we need the output parameters
      environmentName - the name of the environment for which to load the output parameters. The deployed Network construct must have been deployed into this environment.

      @Nullable public @Nullable software.amazon.awscdk.services.elasticloadbalancingv2.IApplicationListener getHttpsListener()
      The load balancer's HTTPS listener. May be null if the load balancer is configured for HTTP only!
